intro: Bossiaea aurantiaca, commonly known as the scarlet bossiaea, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its distinctive orange-red flowers. The plant typically grows in heathlands and open forests, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are alternate and narrow, with a hairy texture, while its flowers are clustered in dense inflorescences. It plays an important role in supporting local pollinators and is often found in coastal regions of southern Australia.
